isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 11: ENGINE ELECTRICAL - MAIN ENGINE WIRING HARNESS - ENGINES EQUIPPED WITH CHASSIS MOUNTED ECM AND IDM UNITS

svcproc.title: ENGINES EQUIPPED WITH CHASSIS MOUNTED ECM AND IDM UNITS

note.para: SEE DIAGNOSTIC MANUAL EGES 145 FOR DETAILS ON ENGINE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLE SHOOTING.

step1.para: Disconnect batteries.

Pull out the wiring harness connector from the under valve cover fuel injector wiring harness connector ( 3, Figure 11.24
).
Push against the connector to loosen it from the valve cover.

Disconnect main engine harness 31-pin connector ( 1, Figure 11.24
).

Remove two (2) bolts securing main engine harness 31-pin connector to valve cover/intake manifold ( 2, Figure 11.24
).

note.para: OVERSTRESSING CONNECTOR LOCK TABS CAN RESULT IN BREAKAGE OF TABS. SPREAD TABS ONLY FAR ENOUGH TO RELEASE CONNECTOR.

step1.para:
Unlatch and separate Camshaft Position Sensor (CMP) connector from CMP sensor. If necessary, remove CMP mounting bolt and pull CMP sensor from front cover ( Figure 11.25
).

Unlatch and separate Engine Oil Temperature (EOT) sensor connector from sensor. If necessary, unscrew sensor from front cover ( Figure 11.26
).

note.para: When the EOT sensor is removed from the front cover, oil will leak out the port.

step1.para:
Unlatch and separate Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT) connector from sensor. If necessary, unscrew the sensor from the cylinder head ( Figure 11.27
).
Remove the Injection Control Pressure (ICP) Sensor as follows:
Engines Equipped With Old Three-Way Fitting

Unlatch and separate ICP connector from sensor. If necessary, remove ICP sensor, together with O-Ring, from the three-way fitting of the supply manifold ( Figure 11.28
).

note.para: Be sure to clean any and all old Loctite(r) found on the threads of the sensor prior to installation.

step1.para: Engines Equipped With New Three-Way Fitting

Unlatch and separate ICP connector from sensor. If necessary, remove ICP sensor, together with O-Ring, from the three-way fitting of the supply manifold ( Figure 11.29
).

note.para: Be sure to clean any and all old Loctite(r) found on the threads of the sensor prior to installation.

figure.caption: Figure 11.28 Removing ICP Sensor From Old Three-Way Fitting
Figure 11.29 Removing Sensor From New Three-Way Fitting

step1.para:
Unlatch and separate Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) connector from solenoid ( Figure 11.30
).

note.para: Refer to Section 12, "HIGH PRESSURE LUBE OIL SYSTEM" for the proper procedure on the removal and installation of the IPR valve.

step1.para: Remove harness securing clamps from valve cover/intake manifold and front cover.
Carefully lift entire main wiring harness free from engine.

caution.para: SHOULD ANY RESISTANCE BE ENCOUNTERED, DO NOT TUG ON HARNESS TO FREE IT. INVESTIGATE SOURCE OF RESISTANCE AND FREE CONNECTOR OR CLIP, THEN REMOVE HARNESS FROM ENGINE.

svcsubproc.title: Inspection
svcsubproc.para: Use the following steps when inspecting the wiring harness:

step1.para: Be sure to clean any and all Loctite(r), if present from the threads of the sensors.
Check all connector pins on sensors. If bent or corroded, replace sensor.
Carefully inspect wiring harness for worn conduit, frayed insulation or heat damage on wires. Refer to the following repair section should repair be necessary.
Inspect each connector for the following conditions. Replace as required.

step2.para: Corroded connectors - green or gray-white deposits on metal terminals.
Terminals incorrectly latched into connector body or "pushed back" relative to other terminals in the same connector.

figure.caption: Figure 11.30 Disconnecting Injection Pressure Regulator Valve
